title: Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old column names when selecting the dataset
OB: When selecting the dataset in the expression builder and double-clicking on the first column name, the original name of the column is displayed instead of the alias name.
EB: According to scr 78193 in the tracker, the first column in the expression builder should use the alias name instead of the original name. After double-clicking the original name, the alias name should be displayed as row["column1"].
SR:
Bug 118780: Set alias for columns in data set but in expression builder still shows the old column names when selecting the dataset. 

Description:
1. Create a new data source and a dataset.
2. Set the alias of the first column in the dataset to "column1".
3. Insert a data item and bind it to the dataset.
4. Open the expression builder and select the dataset.
5. Double-click on the first column name.

Expected Result:
The alias name "column1" should be displayed in the expression builder.

Actual Result:
The original name of the first column is displayed instead of the alias name in the expression builder.
